ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Substance Abuse Disorder (SUD) since last TADS visit
Notes: 0 = No SUD since last TADS visit 1 = SUD since last TADS Visit
1 = AD: Alcohol Dependence 2 = AA: Alcohol Abuse 3 = SD: Substance Dependence 4 = SA: Substance Abuse 5 = ND: Nicotine Dependence

1 = Marijuana; 2 = Cocaine/Crack; 3 = Opiates; 4 = Non-prescription Methadone; 5 = Hallucinogens/Psychedelics; 6 = Methamphetamines; 7 = Prescribed stimulants; 8 = Benzodiazepines; 9 = Barbiturates; 10 = Non-prescription GHB; 11 = Ketamine; 12 = Inhalants; 13 = Other

0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Event offset: Weeks-TADS Time 0 to asst. Weeks from TADS Time 0 to assessment
Months from SOFTAD enrollment date to assessment
Gate B/C: SA, SD, AA, or AD (SUD) History
Post Week 12, Substance Use Disorder: abuse or dependence
Post Week 12, Alcohol Use Disorder: abuse or dependence
Post Week 12, Alcohol or Substance Use Disorder (SUD)
